description:
Oh my god, I'm obsessed with their taco salad!  I have it delivered to my work every Wednesday and the bag is so heavy, I can literally make 3 meals out of this order.  Salad is decadent and fresh with avocado and a delish taco shell! 

I want to go to the restaurant instead so I can explore the whole menu of getting delivery soon because I'm so happy with this one dish.
author: Meagan M.

description:
Ordered for pick up and now that I'm home I find both Super burritos I ordered don't have guacamole or sour cream one of which I asked for extra sour cream. I paid for 2 super burritos and that's not what I got. From past experiences overall their food is really good when they prepare it how it was actually ordered!

Was going to give 3 stars because I'm HANGRY and didn't get the burrito my heart was set on but I called the restaurant and they did offer to fix it by giving me a free burrito so Im giving 4 stars even though I'm not able to go back today for it .
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Came here as I visited a salsa dance class close  by. 
It had good reviews so I had to check this taqueria out. 
There is little parking up front but found something a bit further down the road. 
My bf ordered a chicken quesadilla and I ordered 3 tacos (carne asada and al pastor). We ate there and received complimentary chips with salsa. Not sure if that's just if you eat in or maybe you get it after spending a certain amount. Else chips are $1.25. When we received our order, we had to double check that the quesadilla was indeed a quesadilla- it looked like a burrito. We got the right thing and the quesadilla was very different (less cheesy) than what we both have tried previously. However, it was still delish as it was flavorful and creamy- just different execution (see pic). The tacos had a good amount of meat but thought they could have had a bit more seasoning or something. To me they were average and would get the quesadilla or burrito next time instead  
Got aqua Fresca with a yelp check in. Choice was horchata or melon. Chose melon and it was really good. Fruity drink but not as heavy and sweet as a regular juice.
author: Christina I.

description:
This review is for the regular shrimp burrito and salsa/chips.

The burrito was pretty weak and bland. It was $12.75 with tax. So that is unacceptable. The rice was moist. But the shrimp were plain jain and has no substance. Taq. San bruno is still the standard when it comes to mexican seafood. 

Place charges $1.25 for bland trash salsa and chips. Or you can get it free with a checkin and other methods. Green one is never good anywhere but the red salsa looked chunky/hearty but was a let down. And honestly I wouldn't trust a place that can't give complimentary salsa. 

Located in a trash area so the prices r a lil shocking given the quality or lack thereof. 

Would not return at least for seafood
author: Atif J.

description: One of the worst burritos I've tried near the missions I've ask for a steak burrito with cheese they put no steak in my burrito no cheese it was all rice and beans I don't recommend this place stay away.....
author: Ramon E.

description: Whoop! What a gem in this neighborhood that delivers. Burritos are superb with lots of chicken filling (chicken in red sauce cooked to perfection), 3 different types of hot sauce and the fajita salad was massive with lots of lettuce and onions. Can't rave on about how tasty their meals and how good the portion size are.
author: Carmen P.

description:
I had the Vegetarian Taco Salad to go and it was good, but not the best taco salad I've ever had. The photos online were a bit deceptive - it showed whole cherry tomatoes, and there was just the diced tomato topping instead. I also asked for no onions, and there was tiny chopped onions all over the side, which I had to pick off.

After you add on all the toppings (beans, sour cream, extra sauce?, pico) the lettuce (spring mix) gets pretty soggy and it just can't handle all the wet ingredients. 
Overall it was ok, but it was a bit wet to eat.
author: Larissa S.

description:
Wow! Came here on a taco Tuesday, surprised it was not that crowded. I should have been with how amazing their tacos were! We've seen the line out the door in the mornings for breakfast burritos, so we had to try!
We are from So Cal and have been having trouble searching for a good Mexican food place here in SF. I had the al pastor and chili verde and my boyfriend had al pastor, chili verde, and asada. I LOVED the al pastor and my boyfriend said his chili verde taco was the best taco he's ever had. & Both salsas were very delicious -always a plus for me! This is the place to go to if you're looking for authentic Mexican food!
author: Megan M.

description:
We are really happy with the new array of restaurants delivering to our neck of the woods (Bayview), even if via GrubHub for $5.00 - $15.00 delivery fee.

(Beggars can't be choosers.)

Bayshore Taqueria is one of these new places and I absolutely love their food. Their steak nachos are super tasty and my husband loves their super tacos, burritos, and carne asada plate as well. Not a fan of the runny "guac" but please reference what I said up there in parentheses. All in all, this place is great, and we will continue to order takeout from them.
author: Joanna R.

description: Thankful this is one of the closest taquerias to my place. No need to wait in a line at Farolito or La Taqueria for my burrito fix. Try the Super Fajita Burrito. The grilled peppers and onions really add to the steak burrito flavor. Staff is super friendly. Wish they had more availability on evenings and weekends, but I'll take my fix when I can get it.
author: Michael M.

description:
Came in and checked in as they have an offer. They aLso had an offer printed and posted where you order. When we asked about getting both, they said we only get the free drink, not chips. That's okay.....

I ordered the carnitas burrito. My bf the quesadilla with lengua and chorizo.

The carnitas was dry. Not much to talk about.

The lengua was good and the chorizo was good. My bf liked this place a lot. I thought it was okay. In the end we got the chips and horchata for free. Which is nice. The horchata was authentic, my bf loved it! I don't usually like green sauce and theirs was pretty bomb. 

They have a nice area to sit and eat. It looked like a lot of regulars come to this place.
author: Lynn C.

description: Right when you think you know the city and have settled into your favorites, this place slaps you awake. Amazing flavors. To me this place nails the flavor profile of what I think is good Mexican food. So far I have only tried 3 different mains: super quesadilla, shrimp fajitas, and a burrito. If this cross section of menu items is any indication of what the rest of menu is like, my quality of life just shot up. Plus you got to love the hard to get to location. It's just inconvenient enough to minimize the crowds. My $3 delivery charge from GrubHub?...without a second thought.
author: Darin E.

description:
What a great find. Check in to get a free large agua fresca. The pineapple one will blow your mind. 
Despite the surrounding area, this place is clean and quaint inside. 
There is a large variety of meat choices including lengua. Breakfast burritos and Their fridge is also stocked with jarritos, Mexican beers as well as local brews. I chose the carne asada nachos. My wife went crazy for the lengua soft tacos.
I'm stopping here every time I'm close.
author: mannie r.

description: . I had the going Carne asada burrito. With some chips. The burrito met my expectations. The chips need a little more salt and salsa needed a little more kick. But over all the meal was good.
author: Jose R.

description: Came in 20 minutes before 9 and they refused to make food for me. Clearly I could see all the food sitting there. The young lady was super rude and said they'll be cleaning so that we couldn't order anything. Why not just close the door? The door was open but you aren't serving food? 20-25 minutes before closing they just won't serve you any food.
author: Sean V.

description:
Came in wanting to try some super nachos(myfave) for some odd reason I was really craving some carnitas over the usual carne asada.

Ordered Carnita SuperNachos for $11 even though I swear It said 7.95 but that didn't bother me too much.

The chips they used for the nachos were really good as well as the cheese. 

The carnitas though.........DUN DUN DUN!!!!!!! The meat was nicely cooked and not too fatty but.. it lacked flavor

Which ended up making my plate of nachos mediocre.

Therefore I rate this experience a 3 out of 5. Maybe next time I will try the carne asada super nachos and I'll update this review. 

But if that fails me then I'll most likely not come back.

Don't forget to check in on yelp. I got a free agua fresca. 

Sidenote: Jack in the box down the street is legit! Sourdough is always nice and crunchy
author: Jose R.

description:
We came here before and it was very good , craved Mexican food decided to come here , the service was awesome but the food somehow went down hill and the soup of the day the menudo? I think it's not correct of spelling . Omg I had better , oil and it was barley anything in it ???? My husband got 6 chicken tacos and got 2 super tacos and the nachos hmmmm they need to really take time on their nachos and put live in it because it was no love in those tacos. 

So expensive for all that food 45? Really and it wasn't even much in my soup all water and the nachos was barley anything in there. We won't be coming back here .
author: Hoa T.

description: Tacos were delicious but expensive and took a while to make. Parking is also in a weird place that doesn't feel super safe.
author: Elisa D.

description:
I've vowed not to vilify any more 1 star businesses, they do it on their own. 

See my picture of the 3 enchilada plate (to go). 

$16.81 with tip. 3 anemic enchiladas the size of corn street tacos. Mush of refried beans. Stale rice. Iceberg lettuce pico de gallo.  Brutal sad. #NeverSayEdible
author: Nik D.

description:
My first time using uber eats and I'm so glad I did because this burrito was the bomb . com!! 

I ordered the "Super carne asada" burrito, despite others comments of it being way too big.. I was able to mow down about 3/4 of it before even taking a breath. So I say go big or go home with this place!

I wrote in the app asking to "add lettuce"  (I figured would probably not happen) which to my delight they did! It's definitely not spicy so if you like spice ask for hott sauce, also next time I would definitely order extra guac inside.
author: Molli W.

description:
Bayshore Taqueria is a yummy option when you're not looking to make the trek down to the Mission for Mexican food. The food is well priced, the portions are generous, and over all the flavors are delicious.

I had the taco plate, one carne asada taco and one al pastor, with rice and black beans. YUMMY! The meat was tender and flavorful, all the salsas were delicious too. I'm a real sucker for salsa verde, there's was spicy and delicious, but the sweeter salsa really stood out as the flavors felt new and unfamiliar. Everyone in my group left happy and full. 

The only reason I cannot give this place 5 stars is because I've had sensational tacos else where. Also, the woman taking our order told us she was too busy to make us a margarita - the place wasn't busy, but I've been in the serving industry and was sympathetic.
author: Adriana G.

description:
Just ok. I got the regular carne asada burrito and a side of chips and salsa. Nothing special and really kinda disappointed... the beef didn't have much flavor - plus had to pay extra for the chips.
There are better taquerias for sure!
author: J D.

description: This place is really for the shits I hope it close its rat city and TARIQ knows it and gives it not even dam bit of change rats every were in that place huge rats in his words your a bum man tell your customers rats rule your KITCHEN stay sweet
author: Iz F.

description: I ordered from doordash with free delivery with a $20 minimum.  My deliverer and the eatery were super fast.  BTaqueria's food is almost like gourmet mexican like Tacorgasmico!!  The food is so fresh,  tasty, authentic Mexican!!  You can have spinach tortilla or tomato tortilla. You can have sauce on your burrito so it tastes even more like a meal! You can have 2 or more types of meats or shrimp with meats.  They have vegetarian burritos/tacos.  They have soft tacos or crisp tacos that look like little mini taco salads.  Even their nachos were light and heated up (not the stale old hard-to-bite-into nachos that taquerias usually throw into your bag with your burrito) with guacamole sauce that wasn't too hot  (i hate it when taquerias give you blazing hot fire-breathing dragon sauces that will burn your tongue and lips off!!).  The only problem is the food is pricey and the portions are not huge.  $2.75 for a large horchata aqua fresca, nearly $14 for a 2-meat superburrito.  Still, they're a far cry from the usual Mexican burrito places that serve more fat & heat than taste near the outer mission.  And in the Bayshore, I wouldn't have expected Mexican food this good, this gourmet.  Thumbs up!!
author: Frugal C.

description: Seems like there has been a change in ownership. The prices have gone up drastically ($15 for a steak plate), and the chips and salsa are now $1.50. Unacceptable.
author: Long C.

description: Food here is good but could improve with a little more season on meat for flavor.... price is better than competition nearby and food portion are huge i recommend nachos and burritos they are great choice
author: Ivan C.

description:
I was looking for a wet burrito, I saw the yelp reviews and hands down this lived up to my expectations. The burrito was great, crispy carnitas just as it should be, excellent salsa-with plenty of flavor and obviously fresh quality vegetables. The sauce was top notch, plenty of flavor, the guacamole was also fresh and well seasoned. My brothers el pastor burrito was properly grilled and tasty as hell.

The staff was friendly and the food came fast and well played. All in all Bayshore Taqueria is top both- I'll definitely be back.
author: Jason D.

description: This is my favorite Taqueria period. The food is fresh and delicious. I get lunch and dinner here many tines per week. Perfect spot on the way home from work to Bernal Heights.
author: Nicholas P.

description: I order some super nachos shrimp and beef the fuckin shrimp was raw they had me fucked up was already home when I checked da food or would've bought they shit rite back
author: DaJuan M.

description:
I stopped by and had a burrito bowl today, and man was it a good choice!  The carne asada burrito bowl hit the spot, and cashed in on the free agua fresca with the Yelp check in offer.

Bayshore taqueria is very good at making carne asada the right way, with nice grill marks and a great bite, and seasoned simply to let the beef flavor shine!  The prices are very fair, this super asada bowl w guacamole and crema is only about $7.50. 

I hear there fish tacos are good, so I'll have to come back and try seafood soon.  Also, they make very good salsa, all have enough salt and a good amount of heat from the chiles. This place also has great service and a variety of sodas from Mexico, so stop by to try the carne asada tacos!

Updated 1/26/15

I just bumped this place up to 5 stars, after several visits, and getting to know Tarik,the owner ,this place has become a go to when visiting SF.  The salsa is very good, and with a Yelp check in, Facebook, check in on Instagram or a photo he will give you an agua fresca or free chips and salsa.  Come check this place out, definitely better than many places in the Mission, and just minutes away from there.
author: Marlon T.

description: 49er burrito is delicious! Love that they have happy hour chips :) super nice owner and a hidden gem in Bayview
author: Stephanie M.

description: I saw an ad for this place on Instagram and thought "why not" even though I am usually disappointed by restaurants advertised in my Instagram feed, this place really surprised me the location is super random, and quite honestly, it doesn't look the best from the outside, but outside appearance isn't everything. The service was pretty fast, The burrito I ordered was huge and probably one of the best I've had here in San Francisco. I have been recommending this place to all of my friends and they have also had a positive experience!
author: Alison J.

description:
I took my time before writing a review. I visited 3 times...
Awesome spot! The food is so good. My favorite thus far is the super vegetarian taco with black beans. Lord, lord, lord!! So the same girl helps me when I come in. She has amazing customer service skills. The cooks speak. Service is fast, I mean... I have no complaints. My food is always hot and tasty. Being a huge foodie, my palate is very high and I'm telling you, food is good here. Best Mexican in this area by far.
author: Nicole E.

description:
I love this new find. I was hungry one late afternoon and just needed a snack.  Of course I went to Yelp to search for a place nearby where I was at the time. 

This place sounded great and Yelp again didn't disappoint.  I asked what was good when I got there and they recommended carnitas so I got that.   I also got lengua once I found out they had it. Lengua is beef tongue and frankly this is how I judge if a taqueria is authentic Mexican. 

This one is truly authentic. Both tacos were delicious and the place gave me both free chip and salsa and Aqua Fresca since it was my first time there.  For $7 including tip, I was super happy and so was my tummy. ;-).
author: Lei H.

description:
If I could give this place 6 stars, I would. My friends helped to plan my baby shower there (we wanted to be close to Bernal for karaoke at the Lucky Horseshoe that night) earlier this month. 
The owner went ABOVE and BEYOND to make this a special night for us, reserving the patio, putting up string lights, covering the tables with table cloths and taking our orders at the table instead of everyone having to go up to order. Everyone who worked there was warm, friendly, and helpful without being intrusive. We ended up staying way later than we'd thought because we were made to feel so comfortable and were having a great time.
AND the FOOD was GREAT!!! 

I can't say enough about the quality and integrity of this business. 
Thank you Bayshore Taqueria for a wonderful, memorable night!
author: Katrina R.

description:
This place has gone downhill.
Today: Over-priced Super Veggie
burrito. 
Rice was bland and flavorless.
Skimpy, tiny amount of:
Tomatos, sour cream, cheese & guacamole. $10.
I'm done with this place.
Better, bigger, and cheaper burritos 
at 3 different spots within 1/2 a block.
Hasta....
author: Kirk B.

description: They're taco salads are bomb af. They do not skimp on ingredients. They have the Mexican Coke and beers. Plus happy hour is 3-5 which includes $1 off beverages and free chips n salsa. Plenty of seating.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Hell yeah!!! I just had the normal carne Asada taco. Dank!!! Al pastor super taco. Dank!!! The sauce on the al pastor was great. The al pastor was very tender and juicy. I can't wait to go back for their al pastor burritos!

Also, the agua Fresca tamarind was really good. It's got a little spice to it.
author: Adidas W.

description: I had the vegetarian tacos and they were great! My friend had the Carne Asada Tacos and they were fresh and juicy. As well as I had the freshly made Horchata! Glad I found this Gem in the rough!
author: Lisa W.

description:
I went back to this Taqueria and took my daughter. We tried tacos. She had two regular hard shell grilled chicken tacos and and I had a steak super taco. 
Once again I give it 5 stars! We have found our new Mexican restaurant. They also deliver!
author: Joan D.

description:
Wow!  This place is a great find!  We just moved to Bernal and think we've just discovered our go-to spot for tacos!

The tacos are generously sized, super flavorful, and really hit the spot.  At $2.75 each, they're also a great price.

The service and setting are basic.  They have good music playing, which is nice.

Overall - great tacos!  We'll be back very soon.
author: Barnali D.

description: I loved the super burrito very juicy and flavorful and great customer service ! I'll be back !
author: Kayla S.

description: First time comming to this restaurant. I ordered my usual I normally ordered at taquerias Super Burrito with steak no beans and extra stake with less rice. I got to say it was extremely fresh and the meat had no cartilage in it. There's salsa also is freshly key I can totally tasting it no can or left to sit food here. Employees really took care of me and made my food exactly how ordered it. I couldn't of made much own Burrito better may self.
author: Jenny S.

description:
So I often get asked, "What are you?", to which I respond, "human". When I do tell them my ethnic make-up, I've once gotten the "Oh, I really like Chinese food", to which I responded, "Isn't the orange chicken at Panda Express the best?"

Well, that did the job. He gave me a crazy look and walked away.

I love Panda Express' orange chicken but I prefer Mexican food over Chinese food. And, although I have my all-time favorite taqueria in the Excelsior: Mexico Tipico, I'm always on a hunt for great lengua. And, I've found it at Bayshore Taqueria.

Bayshore Taqueria is in the cutties across from the Old Clam House. The makeshift parking lot only fits three cars. Sadly, their operation hours are VERY limited which makes it difficult to visit regularly. On weekdays, they close at 7 pm. On Saturdays, they close at 5 pm and they're closed on Sundays. (Update 6.10.15: Janet T. informed me that they now close at 3 pm Monday - Saturday. I called, and the employee confirmed this). *le sigh* They have an enclosed dog-friendly patio though. Yay!

I judge a taqueria's authenticity on the meats they offer. If they don't offer tripas, buche, or lengua, I won't bother visiting. Bayshore Taqueria offers lengua but not the other two but they offer other meats not found at other taquerias like tocino and jamon. I read that on Tuesdays, they offer fusion burritos like chicken adobo burritos. It would be awesome if they can offer various fusion burritos as a daily special every day.

We had just come from happy hour at Holy Water so I was a bit tipsy, and of course wanted e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g off the menu (standard taqueria menu plus burrito bowls). This is a girl who once ordered $150 worth of hotel room service at 3 am then never ate the food because I had passed out. =X 

Anyhow, we ordered the Super Nachos w/ carnitas ($8.95) and two Lengua Super Burritos w/ double meat ($9.25 each). I like ordering double meat in burritos so I have leftovers for another meal. 

I really should NOT be in charge of ordering because we couldn't even finish the nachos (also received complimentary chips), and we only managed to share 1/4th of one burrito. 

The Super Nachos w/ carnitas: http://bit.ly/1Jom7sn came in a heaping mound of super crunchy chips topped with refried beans, melted shredded cheese, carintas, fresh pico de gallo, crema, and guac. I rarely order carnitas because I find it dry and a lot of taquerias season the sh*t out of it. Not here. The carnitas is super tender, moist, and lightly seasoned. I wish there was more than 4 pieces though. The nachos also needed more cheese. Only about 1/4th of the chips had cheese on them.

We were pretty stuffed by now but we had to try our Lengua Super Burritos: http://bit.ly/1BM92RL. I think I should have ordered it sans refried beans because it was too wet for my liking. It didn't seem like we received double meat so Mr. NSS went back to the counter to inquire. The owner was nice enough to bring us out a bowl of lengua and sincerely apologized (this would never happen at other taquerias). We went to town on the bowl of lengua and saved our burritos for leftovers. 

Dat lengua doe. 

It was incredibly tender and moist, just like the carnitas. It's on the blander side which is just fine by me. The texture was so soft like it had been stewing for hours, and not masked with commercial seasoning blends. Tater Tot was with us so we gave him a little piece and he went nuts over it.

Tater Tot and furparents approved.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Oh man. It's good. Chicken is for real. My delicious super burrito bowl with chicken and refried beans was not very spicy which I like!! If you like spicy you might have to add hot sauce.
author: Lisa M.

description: Went to this taqueria randomly today and all I have to see is wow.  Killer food, great Latin tunes, and Tarik (owner) literally came to our table and asked us about the food.  Burrito bowl was fantastic, my wife had two delicious veggie tacos and we washed down the food with two ice cold Coronas.  Ambience is "mexico authentic", no frills and perfect.  Check it out.
author: Chris C.

description:
Probably the best burritos I've ever had.   The neighborhood isn't too hot and parking can be hard to find.

I went here on an early Saturday afternoon, and the place had a few people so I was able to get my burrito quickly.  The staff was nice and prepared the burrito really well.  It was a super, but bigger than other super burritos I've had--and my fat butt has had a fair share.  It was wrapped nicely with all the ingredients was kept in place and didn't make a mess everywhere.  That's when I know, along with the delicious and fresh taste, that this was a bomb-ass burrito.
author: Chan L.

description: Always great and friendly people at the counter. Its rare that something uncommon comes out. Fresh bowls food as well.
author: Jonathan S.

description: My go to. Prices are affordable, food is great & customer service is always excellent. The Burrito Bowls are my absolute favorite.
author: Tynesha B.

description:
I love me some bayshore taqueria.

i enjoy getting the chips and salsa because the chips taste fresh, with a pretty good crunch to them. i especially like the green salsa, not too spicy, and the red salsa because of the taste of tomatoes some smokiness.

what i usually get is a regular burrito with lengua and refried beans. the outcome is pretty spot on; a substantial burrito with good flavor not drenched or overwhelmed by any sauce or one flavor. the flavors are spot on, salsa, beans, meat, rice; not doing too much, keeping it simple.
author: Alvin G.

description:
Woohoo! Bayshore Taqueria is as good as it gets!
I've been to Bayshore Taqueria twice now, and my biggest gripe is that they're not open enough! What I mean is I wish they were open after 8 pm on weekdays because I appreciate their food and service so well.
I've had their veggie and meat options, and they are all awesome. The pollo, pastor and carnitas are to die for. I haven't found meat this tasty in a Mexican join in awhile.
Also, mad props for having a covered patio where I can bring Fido my dog (not my dog's real name, but it's like John Doe for dogs). On a nice warm night, it is the place to be.
Keep up the good work, Bayshore!
author: Andrew J.

description:
**Update:  the owner messaged me and told me that they have a sign with ways to get free chips and salsa when you come in posted by the register.  This is cool and I'll try that next time, but just note that the cashier offered the chips and salsa in Spanish to the two fellows in line after me...just sayin.  i really appreciated the owner's thoughtful retort to my review and will definitely give them another try.**
 
Original review:
After leaving BevMo with a fussy dog and it being an hour past my and my dog's normal grandma dinner time, I was about ready to throw a fit from *h-anger* so I stopped off at this Taqueria on my way home. I called as I was pulling out of the parking lot of BevMo and ordered an enchilada plate and a Horchata (because yelp had a check in offer for a free Agua Fresca and you can't beat free). 

When I got there, there was no parking, so I had to create-a-spot which is an old family secret. 

Bayshore Taqueria is really dank looking, complete with a dim lighting and hobos crack-heading around outside the front door. Mmm, so hungry. The girl at the register was extremely sweet on the phone and in person. But I was surprised to hear my total for an enchilada plate and a free drink was a whopping $14.08 and the meal does not come with chips and salsa which was a huge boner killer. 

When I got home, I came to find out that this food seriously tastes exactly like La Corneta which you might think is a good thing but there's a reason that I don't go to La Corneta and that reason is that the food tastes really oily to me and I'm just extremely sick of it after going there for 10 years. Bayshore's beans are way better than Corneta's though. But La Corneta only has one hobo out front and that guy has a great sense of humor and is far less likely to shank you so Corneta wins on that count. 

Would I go back to this Taqueria? Only if I were in the same situation that I found myself in tonight, where my only other option was fast food, but, honestly, in that situation I would probably just go for fast food. This place wasn't bad, don't get me wrong, I just found it to be mediocre and coupled with the fact that it's overpriced and there's ABSOLUTELY no parking.
author: Emma H.

description: It's not in the best location ever, but the grade-A food more than makes up for it. Seriously, this is some of the best Mexican food I've ever had, and I'll find myself going out of my way just to try it again.
author: Erik B.

description: Love Love Love this place!! I come here every time I am in SF! My Super fajita burrito best I've ever had.. I love the staff here too!!
author: Cheryl S.

description: Not a bad ambiance and of course, it feels like you're in Mexico when you get to eat outside. The inside ordering area is simply a tight place and there's no more than 3 people working there at a time. Did like the food, but the carne asada burrito could of been more flavorful.
author: Lola M.

description:
Just went here with my wife before shopping at Lowe's.  We ended up getting the Super Burrito with Carnitas.  It was a solid burrito. 

The staff was so nice. They ended up asking if we wanted it cut in half, which was great for sharing.

I would definitely come back when we are in the neighborhood again.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Friendly staff. At first I was skeptical about their food and how they had it buffet style, I didn't think it was fresh. So judgement  of me but food came out great, fresh and tasty.
author: Meishi M.

description: They have an ongoing Groupon deal available and I've purchased it 4 times this year. What can I say? This place makes bomb food! I love their nachos & burritos. I'm a fan of their carnitas, grilled chicken and chili verde
author: Jodie L.

description:
Had a burrito here, and tried the Nachos.  Everything purchased tasted fresh and yummy.  I had a groupon deal.  I'm glad I got two groupons for here b/c it was that good.  The only setback might be the chips but it's free so I don't care for it.  But my friend that got the nachos said the chips were a bit salty.  I tried it I didn't think it was, so I'm givin this a 5 star.  I think you get off on Cesar chavez exit from highway 101 and then it's around the corner.  

Owner was down to earth, super friendly & nice!  He seemed pretty young in his late 20's or 30's (could be a family buisness-not sure) This place is Dog Friendly!!!  If you have a doggie here, you just gotta eat outside in the patio area that has a roof covering, tables, seating, & windows.  NOT inside the restaurant though.  It looked like it's inside though but it's not.  I came here on a super hot day so it was great sitting on the outside. Yey!!  My poochie was so happy just sitting there.  Finally a place where I can bring him to eat too!!  But please do clean the seats afterward if your poochie is gonna sit there.  That's what I did b/c my doggie left foot prints on the chair.  This is just out of respect.  

This place is a hidden gem.  I'll definitely be back for more.  Tip: If you have a groupon for this place you can't get the free fresca drink offer for that yelp checkin.  

They don't have self serve salsa but they do have self serve water. There are hot sauces bottles on the table.  A tabasco sauce, a green one sauce (that's my favorite b/c kind of soury) and another one that he said is super hot (and of course I didn't try this.  I was already very satisfied with the green one and the tabasco sauce).  This place is worth trying if you like Taquerias.  :)  I can say one of my favorites.
author: Juila L.

description: Free drink when you check in. Awesome! The tacos were amazing. Plenty of meat. Got the grilled chicken carne Assad. Two thumbs up!
author: Bubba G.

description: I haven't been impressed with any burritos up in SF until now! (I was spoiled by the Mexican food in SD) We got the super burrito and combo plate which were both super flavorful. Portions were large as well. Heads up - There's limited street parking. Will be coming here again!
author: Christine H.

description: Ordered the super burrito carne asda/lengua. Burrito was very flavorful, quite tasty! The reason for the 4 stars i spent an extra 6 dollars on extra meat but it was same portion as regular. Spent 17.50 on a Burrito.... hopefully they can make it back up to me!
author: Stan C.

description: I ordered the Super Carne Asada Burrito Bowl. Good portion size and not messy like the burrito version. An order of Nachos was also a good portion. Came here with a group of 8 people and was able to ask the staff to turn to bring tables together.
author: Jimmy D.

description: Great carnitas quesadilla. Lively atmosphere with loud music. Prompt courteous service. Great place for a pit stop meal.
author: Richard L.

description: Very consistent for the most part, and the crowd is right about the carnitas--exceptional. But we had one off day experience where we ordered super burritos, which are supposed to have sour cream, guacamole, and cheese; looks like we got the sour cream, but other than that the burritos were bone dry. So, minus one star...
author: Mar R.

description: I still love the food here, but it seems like their prices went up quite a bit lately. I just paid $12.89 for a regular shrimp quesadilla. With the 15% tip, that was just under $15!!  I'll still come back, but it will take me a while to get used to the price increase.
author: Eddie K.

description:
(ubereats)

Cheap (less than 10), decent size but not huge, meat-filled, DELISH burrito. And came with free tortilla chips! Dangerous, but not too dangerous.

Would recommend.
author: B H.

description: Always kind and courteous staff. Tasty food and reasonable pricing. Their menu is straight forward and simple, yet it has good variety. Try their Super Breakfast Burrito!
author: Dayne C.

description: So good!! We have just converted from our favourite Mission taqueria to Bayshore- it's so good! Love that we can order on Uber eats and have it in less than half an hour. I love the taco salad with grilled chicken and my husband has the burrito bowl. Both are huge and so fresh and tasty, definitely recommend a visit!
author: Allie S.

description: One night, my husband went online to find a restaurant to have dinner. He used a Groupon coupon which I had never heard. After thinking about the address I just could not remember an eatery other than a Dominos Pizza. After some urging, I drove by with hesitancy, but remebering not to judge. I went inside and the food looked pretty good, so I ordered the Taco Salad. My word! That was the biggest and best Taco Salad I'd ever eaten. I am picky about how food looks and smells. I went back the next day for another. Did I mention this salad can feed two easily as the helpings are great for the money.  I live in the Excelsior District of San Francisco and there are two Taquieras two blocks away. One of them are my favorite, but I've never had a Taco Salad. I will go out my way to get a great Taco Salad. I'm going tonight as soon as my husband comes in from work. I went two weeks ago but I came a little too late as they had closed for the night. The Enchiladas are heavenly as they were not overrun with red sauce the way I prefer them. Delicious!
author: Rosalind H.

description:
I FELL IN LOVE with their TACO SALAD! The homemade nacho bowl they put the salad in is TO DIE FOR!! The taste and quality of their carne asada tho.. taste, ehh I've had better/quality, pretty tough and almost rubbery o.O 

If you go here.. you MUST try the CARNITAS (pork) ITS SOOOO DELICOUS! They also make there own nacho chips c(:

The horchata is blah.. you can tell its just a powdery mix )': and once you drink it to the bottom.. you're guaranteed to see about a 1/2" thick of mix resting at the bottom 

But anyways, FIVE STARS BECAUSE THEIR TACO SALADS ARE AWESOME!
author: Chelsey B.

description: Gang... this is my new spot in the entire San Francisco! Funny how I go to Lowes nearby all the time. This time I was fixing my window because some fools break into my car. Then I decided to stop by this taco place. Man, this taco is for real!!! Great prices, ambient and the cash register was very friendly and nice. Ended up having a quick chat with the owner and I must say, my respect, he is passionate about his taco and his Taqueria! Definitely will stop by and bring all my salsa dancing friends and all my friends here! Awesome work guys! You might be asking, where is the pictures??? Well the freaking taco was so good that that I grub them as soon I got them. Didn't have time for the picture!  Had beef and chicken taco and it was delicioso!!!!! Haaaa :) next time picture!!!
author: IHeartMambo S.

description: I ordered a super nacho plate from these guys. It's mainly for a meat eater and I didn't choose a meat option. I got a call from them right away and asked what meat I wanted on it and I said none, he said "oh okay, well I will hook you up then." I got a ton of beans, rice, and extra nachos and guac. This is awesome, whoever talked to me on the phone rules.  The food is great too. I'll be back here a lot.
author: Sari S.

description: Delicious authentic Mexican. I had the combo plate w carnitas , chicken enchilada and pork tamale. Beans and rice like mom makes. Tastes like home cooking. Look no further.
author: Carrie C.

description:
Came here because of the $5 voucher redeemable for $10. It happened to be a raining day and the parking spot only can fit 3 cars. So found parking a by Jack in the Box and I decided to get the Carne Asada plate. The total was $10.95 but they took the voucher and didn't nickel and dime me for the remaining.

The to go order did miss the green onions I see another person who ate in had. The meat was of decent quality instead of the tendons and veins I normally get for what they call Carne Asada.
author: M C.

description: By far one of the greatest restaurant experiences I've had in a while. Tarik is a great guy. Thanks for the great food and talk man!
author: Gabriel G.

description: Went there on a Groupon deal.  Steak & prawns burritos & chicken soft tacos were both excellent.  Finding parking a little difficult but manageable.  Will be back for more.
author: Denis Y.

description:
We were greeted with a smile as soon as we walked.  Service was fast, and Tarik, the owner, was very friendly and made us feel welcomed!

The BEST burrito I've ever had!  You can order regular burrito or a "Baby Burrito".  I ordered a "baby chicken burrito", and it was still too big for me!  I was only able to eat half of it!

Everything was fresh and tasty! Also got free chips and salsa sauce. Chips were not salty like many places, and sauce was very good!  

No complaints here. We will definitely be back!
author: Judith S.

description:
I am so stoked about getting a cocktail for free(voucher)!
The clerks are friendly, some cuties. The owner, has such a passionate approach to his customers, authentically welcoming!
author: Marco M.

description: I really love this place I always come when I'm in town. Super fajita burrito forever.
author: Bradley B.

description: The service is AWSOME. The food tasted better 6 months ago. Why do I say that? Because the Carnitas that I got in my burrito was like shredded tree bark!!!!..OK so I was quite disturbed after my findings in my burrito, decided to give them a call the very next morning,spoke to the owner, he apologized to me said he had a meeting this morning with his staff and went over the recipes.. Told him I wasn't looking for a free ride just had to vent out my dissappointments, he IS THE GREATEST RESTURANT OWNER IN THE WORLD. He took care of the problem..like I said the service and servers are great I now know where it came from!!!
author: Danita D.

description: Absolute go to for lunch take out at work. These are the places that make you laugh at all the hipster trendy spots every one raves about. So good!
author: Mark E.

description: Taco Tuesday's al pastor so good! Everyone always very nice. My go to spot for my Mexican needs.
author: Skylor V.

description: I've had taqueria style tacos all over SF. Since the taco window closed on 21st street I've been longing for something of that caliber. I have found it! Pastor, say no more. They are very heavy handed on the onion, so if your not a huge fan, you might ask them to hold them. And their hot sauce that comes on the taco reminds me of Taco Bell sauce. Say what you want about Taco Bell but their sauce is the shit. I also love their lime spiked habanero sauce, very spicy.
author: Jake E.

description:
Bayshore Taqueria exceeds the former tenants by having a clean place to dine in menu standard taqueria fare.

eats: lengua burrito (6.25)
-average size with black bean option
-lengua just so so. burrito average 
-salsa and green salsa given with fresh chips fab
3.5 stars

crumbs;
-friendliness and service ups it to 4
-margueritas served here? looked like one.
-food just average.
-fast service, scooping done in kitchen, not at counter.
author: Victor G.

description: I was shopping at bev mo and i had a sudden craving for a burrito. I looked up the street and noticed this taqueria so i had to check it on yelp and i was in luck i has a lot of good reviews so i ordered my food and game over . Satisfied and full boy was it good.People dont sleep on this place the food and the service is on point. The burritos are full of flavor and lots of meat. Being born and raised here in the city and hitting up every taqueria up and down the mission. I cant belive i been passing this place up not too mention they offer service with a smile unlike other taquerias were the people look uptight and miserable. Found me and my family a new burrito spot see you guys soon
author: Miamia1954 R.

description: This place has seriously solid burritos and tacos. It's unexpected location add to the charm. I decided to check it out to switch it up from my normal Mission destinations. It doesn't disappointment and is hands-down one of the best burritos in the city.
author: Jack C.

description:
The super quesadilla I got was thinner than most quesadillas in the mission, but it was very filled and thick (2.5"). I didn't put any salsa on the quesadilla because all the flavor was there. Tasted very good. The flavors of the carnitas was delicious! I definitely will be checking out again.

Good horchata. Chips were ok.
author: Tom L.

description: As soon as we walked in we were greeted and offered samples! The barbecued pork was very good, added in this taco salad. This is a picture of my boyfriend's hand compared to the taco salad. My super quesadilla hit the spot. Will be coming back soon! Glad we tried this place out for the first time
author: Ruby G.

description:
Insanely good Mexican food. Extremely fresh. 

Had their roasted pork burrito bowl. The chef said they used Victoria beer in the marinade. Flawless. I lived in Mexico for 2 years so I've had some really good roasted pork and this is easily top-3 of all time for me. 

Atmosphere was spacious and comfortable. Decent selection of beer. Service was great. Staff was friendly. 

Go.
author: Chris S.

description: I ordered the carne asada soft taco and al pastor breakfast burrito. The carne asada is not greasy and tender. The al pastor breakfast burrito is juicy with the perfect balance of meat, eggs and beans. The pockets of fresh pico add a wonderful burst of flavor and acidity to the mix! Next time, I'm going to add sour cream and extra hot sauce to the breakfast burrito.
author: Lucy W.

description: I probably did the most San Francisco thing of all time by ordering UberEats to my car on a break from Lyfting, lol. I ordered a super burrito pollo en salsa roja. It was soooooooooo good. It honestly had to weigh at least 5 pounds. It was like laying a small baby in my lap. I have a difficult time finding shredded chicken in burritos in the bay, theirs was delicious. It came with free chips and salsa. The good kind of chips that come in a greased up white bag. Omg...I only ate a quarter of it before taking a picture and wrapping it up - so good, so much, felt like I was gonna die. Yummmm! Will be back
author: Nicole P.

description:
This spot is legit, delicious and the service is great. 

Super Veggie Burrito $7.35 - it's large
author: Camille E.

description: Got the super nachos  it was the best I have had in a long time all was very  fresh
author: Ernesto S.

description:
This place and La Espiga de Oro are my favorite taquerias in the area.  

Both are equally good in my opinion and kick the pants off La Taqueria and El Farolito.  I go to the La Espiga if I feel like walking and Bayshore Taqueria if I feel like driving.  

Bayshore Taqueria has the best carnitas in San Francisco and I've been almost everywhere.  
The salsas at Bayshore Taqueria are incredible.  
The fajita salad at Bayshore is also excellent.

I would go here for pretty much anything!  So tasty every single time.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Ordered the carnitas super burrito and super nachos from Uber Eats and was less than impressed given the high rating on Yelp. Both orders were extremely bland, from the meat to the rice, to the pico de gallo and the guac, and the salsa that should have helped with this tasted burnt. The chips also seemed under cooked.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Came here on a Thursday around 1:40
Got helped right away.

Ordered an al pastor burrito with extra pico de galo. It was excellent the ingredients were fresh and the tortilla was soft and warm. Good size also. 

They gave me free chips and salsa . There chili verde salsa tasted fresh and had a tiny kick. The chips are good not to salty. 

I would definetley be back to try the grilled chicken burrito with cheese .

The people here are friendly too :)
author: DOM d.

description: The freshest, healthiest burrito in town! They use real romaine lettuce, have black beans, and my favorite salsa verde (tomatillo, jalapeño, avocado), but no brown rice. They cater!
author: Chris M.

description:
I love it when good food happens in my neighborhood. If you read any of the comments about Bayshore Taqueria (or Jake's Place) you'll notice the common thread of people shocked to find good food on Bayshore. It is an industrial part of the city, but it makes me happy that more and more awesome places like Bayshore Taqueria are opening up. 

Service: super friendly and helpful.
Food: awesome. I had the carnitas super burrito, and even though the carnitas were swimming in guac, sour cream, and refried beans there were still crispy bites. Their avocado salsa verde is divine (when I leave I am going to try to buy a pint to take home). Oh yeah, the watermelon Aqua fresca... Delightful!!!

I'm looking forward to coming for taco Tuesday!!!
author: Lani N.

description:
Step aside Mission District because you have a new serious contender. On the corner of Bayshore Blvd and Oakdale Avenue, you'll find a few new popups that are sure to please! I've recently noticed new window decor on Bayshore Taqueria and decided to check it out on their Taco Tuesday. 

I coincidently popped in on Cinco de Mayo just before closing. They offer $1 tacos on all meats except the obvious (shrimp). I ordered two carnitas, 1 al pastor and 1 grilled chicken. They're slightly smaller than the standard taco, but for $1, can you really complain?! I also added a sangria and during their happy hour (3pm-7pm) its only $4. 

The verdict: Food service was quick and service was exceptional! The owner was very friendly, approachable, and even offers you his specials. He checked in on us once which I appreciated and I was more than happy to give him feedback. The food is unbelievably delicious. The carnitas were flavorful, crispy, with just the right amount of "kick". The al pastor and grilled chicken were also delicious, but my favorite by far is the  carnitas (and luckily I had 2!). The sangria was delicious without being overpowered by any specific flavor. I initially thought it wasn't strong enough, but by the end, I began to feel it kicking in. 

The owner mentioned that he tries to invite other chefs on Tuesdays to offer special tacos. He mentioned doing a fusion taco with korean inspired cuisine, and even fish tacos. You'll definitely have to call to ask him for the week. 

There's ample parking in the area, they accept credit card payments, and hell, its a great spot to check out before it starts getting too crowded by popularity. At this rate, I'd better take advantage before its no longer a yelp secret!
author: Connie C.

description: Everything sold here is fresh and delicious ! The burritos bowls are the best. The super tacos are also a great option. The staff is real friendly and the wait is never too long even when busy. You won't regret trying this place.
author: Carlos M.

description:
I love this place for a couple of reasons. First, the staff and ownership are extremely lovely and friendly. 
Second, I've eaten at the highly reviewed Mexican restaurants on mission and was dissatisfied. This place serves amazing food. Everything cooked to perfection with great taste. Homemade sauce's are delicious and their deals they offer on yelp are very good too. I've gone here 4 times and have enjoyed it every time trying the super burrito, carne asada plates and the nachos. My GF works right around the corner from this place so I get excited when she asks me to meet her for lunch since I know I get to eat food from here!
author: Nik K.

description:
I'm agreeing with others on the five stars. We were looking for a joint that would be easy off, easy on to 101. I was happy to get a breakfast burrito at 1pm on a weekday. The GF got a quesadilla and my brother went less gringo and got real tacos. 

We got our number, sat down and we expected to have to go pick up the grub when it was ready. What was nice is that they had a brief gap in being busy in the lunch rush, and so they had time to deliver the food to our table. This is a nice touch for a restaurant where clearly the expectation is that you pick it up at the counter. 

The food was great, fast and hot; plus, there was plenty of it. Lots of guacamole and crema on my burrito. Others at the table had similar experiences. Yummy in general and not greasy or anything that you sometimes find at other joints. 

For a place I don't know we'd normally visit, we will probably be back!
author: Drew D.

description: Quick drop in for a couple of carne asada tacos. Food was great.
author: Jack L.

description:
Had a groupon and used it today. I ordered to-go  Super Carne Asada nachos and one reg. lengua taco. AND checked in for a free Agua Fresca -strawberry from yelp. 

Arrived to the pad and of course the eating  experience is never the same via dining in the restaurants. Overall the nachos was ok, could use more cheese and both the meats from the taco and nachos were seasoned well. I love the fact they offer free chips and salsa to your meal so that's an extra star.

The counter guy or perhaps the owner? Was very kind and gave me information from weekly guest chefs, taco Tuesdays and Happy hr. I will definitely come thru....follow them on IG: BayshoreTaqueria to win a free meal.
author: Cee M.

description:
New discovery! We had just gotten back from Italy and needed a tacos and burrito "fix". We had never been to Bayshore Taqueria but decided to give it a try. Wow! What a wonderful surprise! The food of quick, fresh, great tasting, reasonable priced and the service incrediblely friendly. 

We had the shrimp tacos and chicken burrito. They both were soooo good! The shrimp,  grilled onions and sauce were exactly what we were desiring. The burrito was huge and the delicious chucks of chicken were perfectly seasoned and prepared. 

We live in Potrero Hill and we WILL BE BACK again and again!
author: Michael R.

description: Came here with a Groupon. The price was quite good and the food was above par. The chorizo was the best and is a MUST GET. The asada and al pastor were good but not great. I wasn't too keen on finishing my tacos. Their nachoes take the cake though. Large portions.
author: Joshua F.

description:
If you're a burrito connoisseur, you've probably read Business Insider's "5 Best Burritos in America."

La Taqueria was deemed "The Best in SF"

Welp, I think it's bullsh*t. (sorry to all you La Taqueria lovers).

 I think there are much better places... like "El Farolito" down the street is better in terms of quality and price.

But the BEST?

I think Bayshore Taqueria is up there among them. 

I think they serve one of the greatest burritos on the face of the planet.

Side: They are under new management with new chefs, new kitchen and a completely new menu.

My burrito was literally the size of my fore arm... and it's only HALF the burrito.

Like, how did I even possibly/physically eat that much? I'm still wondering.

They have all the standard meat choices: steak, grilled chicken, chicken in red sauce, carnitas, al pastor, and pork in green sauce.

But what's really interesting are the Taco Tuesday specials that caters to a true SF foodie's palate.
They have these crazy fusion burritos that you can't get anywhere else.

One week was a crispy pork belly burrito (OMG sooo F'ing crispy), second week was a kalbi burrito (I die), this week was a chicken adobo burrito ( I LOVE adobo). 

So to sum it all up:

Bayshore Taqueria is a quick and cheap Mexican joint that serves quality fresh food that you can taste. Their Tuesday fusion specials are everything!!

And despite the fact that they are located right off the Cesar Chavez exit (traffic hours= the worst), it won't matter in the slightest after you take a bite of your burrito: every bite is filled with hefty slabs of meat, guac, rice, pico, cheese, sour cream and salsa.

For more pics and deets, visit: http://cyneats.com/the-best-burrito-in-san-francisco/
author: Cynthia L.

description: Holy crap!! The fajita salad! Tarik is awesome- the fajita salad is crazy huge!!! Omg!! Great place, great conversation! I'll definitely be back!
author: Ssggirl C.

description:
If your looking for the quintessential taqueria....look no further.
Welcome to BAYSHORE TACQUERIA. Located on Bayshore Blvd (right across the street from The Old Clam House). New ownership, huge improvement! They have a great menu. From tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos, fajitas, salads & lots of breakfast items (huevos rancheros are my favorite).  The staff is extreamly friendly, restaurant is clean and inviting.  The prices are very affordable.  The food is simply DELICIOUS.
They are open Mon-Fri 10-7 and Sat 11-5.
I know I'm definately returning! This place is a solid 5 stars!!!
author: Janet T.

description: do not order a vegetarian burrito here....I work in the area have for 10 plus years, glad to see this place open..had carnitas, good but dude gimme some beans on my veggie orders!  white rice and head lettuce...BS
author: Rroland R.

description:
Broken into 3 categories of cleanliness, deliciousness, and friendliness, Bayshore Taqueria meets all the criteria! 

The gentlemen who helped us was super nice and attentive to our order. This place is a lot cleaner than I have seen for most other Taqueria's (especially those on Mission bleh). And of course the FOOD was delicious! If my boyfriend, the biggest food critic ever, enjoyed the food the you know it's good! 

He got the breakfast burrito and I got the mini super burrito with carne asada (which was perfect size for me!). Amazing flavor! The orchata is also very good in my opinion although my boyfriend thought it was a little too "grainy". But I thought it was good :) 

I will definitely be returning to this place soon!!!!! I hope they are able to keep their 5 stars because I truly think they deserve it!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
There are several reasons I've given 5 stars:  Really nice owner and staff, very fresh tasty ingredients, it's probably the best restaurant to take over this spot and all the beans are ALL vegetarian friendly,  

Really, the owner is an incredibly friendly and nice person that is committed to offering fresh delicious food to his patrons.  It's so important to patronize our small local businesses and this one is very worthy of that patronage.  It's very clear that he values his customers and wants them to be happy.

I love the Super Veggie Burrito, and Super Veggie Tacos and my Uncle loves the Lengua tacos and burritos.  

Everything has been really nice and fresh.

Thumbs Up!
author: Karen L.

description: Pretty good went here for my first time and when you check in they give you a free drink or chips with salsa, I got a regular steak burrito and it was pretty good.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Bayshore Taqueria did SUCH a great job on our office Cinco de Mayo party. The ceviche is soooo good.  And all the food provided was super good (but the ceviche was MY fave).  Tarik is very professional - he even stayed to help me set up...WHICH NEVER HAPPENS...(most places we cater from, someone just plops down a few bags of food, gets a signature, and leaves).  
They catered to our needs, providing a vegan, gluten-free, sprouted brown rice flour tamal, which was amazing!
Great doing business with Bayshore Taqueria.  I had coworkers coming to me even 2 weeks after the party to tell me how much they enjoyed it.
Thanks Bayshore!  Thanks Tarik!
author: K'ra L.

description: Lovely little food shop right next to a market! Interior of the shop is cozy unlike the area around it. Great prices & checking in gets you a free LARGE agua fresca or chips & salsa. It's a bit hard to find parking though...they have tiny parking area but it only holds 2 - 3 cars max
author: Georgia R.

description: Best tacos & burritos this side of San Francisco. The people that run the place are the coolest most welcoming people. Something most places lack.
author: Edwin J.

description: Being from so cal, I eat lots of tacos. I can honestly say this is nowhere near the best taco or nachos I have ever had. The al pastor is passable but avoid the carne asada. It had NO flavor, tasted like flavorless steamed beef. The salsas were all pretty good. The habanero salsa had a bit too much citrus zest for my taste, but it was interesting.
author: Amanda S.

description:
First time trying the place. Got the Tuesday special. Chicken adobo burrito. Very tasty not too salty or greasy. The owner maybe manager was friendly. Free salsa and chips and a big plus your first check in on yelp you great a free large agua fresca with purchase. Score!!
Well  definitely go back and explore more of the menu.
author: Stacy M.

description:
The chips and salsa alone are reason to come here. The salsa's are bomb. Unique and super tasty. 

The carnitas quesadilla was excellent. The carnitas was very good. Great texture and flavor. 

The people that work here are very nice and helpful. The cook brings your food to you too, which is a nice bonus. Very cool place!
author: Daniel W.

description: Carne Asada Plate was delicious! Can't wait to come back and try other items. Chips and horchata were also great. Very friendly service. Highly recommended!
author: Dan C.

description:
Just had my first burrito here (well, I got it to go). A super pastor with refried beans. Also got chips and the hot salsa - and they threw in the green too, saying hey - try it!

When I got home I was pleased to find a nice big burrito, without too much rice, and lots of tasty tasty tastiness inside. The hot salsa was actually hot, and the green salsa was a nice surprise - I'll get it again.

The people who run the place are friendly and clearly enjoy what they are doing. 

I'm looking forward to coming back - I gotta try the carnitas - and I'm really happy that there's a good taqueria so close to my house.

...And there was Football League Championship on the TV, which makes me happy too.

UPDATE: the carnitas. The refried beans. The lengua. The pollo asado. But especially the carnitas. And always soccer on the tv. Come here, eat burritos, be happy.
author: Jacob R.

description: This place is great! Food is pretty amazing and the staff is wonderful ! You gotta come down and try their yummy food !
author: Fadia K.

description:
We've been coming here for years and it just keeps getting better and better. Prices are great, the food is fresh, the service is friendly with a smile. If you're looking for great Taqueria food, this is the place to go.

We often find ourselves at the building supply stores in the area, and always stop by for a little snack.
author: Ghengis G.

description: Delicious food and very friendly people. Had the taco salad with shredded chicken and steak tacos. Will be back when in the neighborhood.
author: Molly H.

description:
I have been to this taqueria just a handful of times.  The place is quite new.  Tarik is a great owner, he is very friendly and clearly enjoys what he is doing.  There is no better taqueria in all of the portola district besides this place. THE BEST - HANDS DOWN!  I am a fan!

Tried the vegetarian 49 wet burrito, OMG--LOVE!!! The sauce is delicious and the burrito is HUGE and yummy... I have also tried the veggie fajita burrito, again I was amazed at the quality and freshness of the food. My mom and daughter love the carne asada burrito.  My daughter was also amazed at how delicious her burrito tasted.   My husband is a fan of the chicken 49 wet burrito.  And about those micheladas----both my husband and I love how tasty they are!  I am usually not a fan of micheladas served at most taquerias, but this one is the best I have ever had.   I'm getting hungry and thirsty just thinking about the food and micheladas!

I am looking forward to going back to this place real soon :) 

Thank you Bayshore Taqueria for the delicious food. Keep it up!
author: Theresa B.

description:
Friendly service and great food.... 
Five stars on Carnitas taco Salad, fresh made Tostada.... Yum-
Four stars on Sangria
We will be back!
author: Millie K.

description: My go to place when i'm in the area...reasonable price, generous portions, friendliest staff, CERVEZAS BIEN FRIAS
author: Oliver U.

description: Good food for reasonable prices....the cashier could stand to be more friendly though...service is about 70% sometimes....no matter how good the food is, if the service lacks, than I will never return.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Really really good spot that I only wish would open on the weekends. Their burritos are never sloppy. I've also try the tacos, and taco salad and they're all really really good. 

I grew up in the Portola and had a treat in Cinco De Mayo, but as the housing prices have gone up, so have the cost of the same burritos I used to purchase for a tad over $5 that is now $9 and some change... 

I just wished this spot would open at least a couple of hours on the weekend.
author: David W.

description: INCREDIBLE! I ate my super burrito bowl so fast because it was so DELICIOUS! Such authentic Mexican food
author: Jackson S.

description: The burritos are off the hook especially the chicken and steak. Been here twice and every time i order food is hot and fresh
author: Sam F.

description: Tried the chicken taco and tortilla chips w/ salsa. Both are excellent. The chicken is marinated very well and the salsas (green/red) are both very flavorful with fresh herbs and ingredients. I'm excited to come back to try more items off the menu.
author: Hai Lee C.

description: Always support small local buisness Really great Mexican food. The Super Baby burrito is great and also the bowls. The 49rs burrito was a wet burrito with guacamole and sour cream the salsa was great. The owner was really nice and suggested us to go look outside San Fransisco for places to stay other than the big city, I thought that was really cool of him. The owner is a cool guy and the food is great. Horchata and Pineapple water was really good he offered me and my boyfriend free drinks for checking in on Yelp, although I didn't have my phone on me he said just leave a review when ever and promised we would. Great restaurant highly recommended. Check in on yelp, leave a review, follow them on Instagram, let him know your having a hard day and you get free drinks cool!
author: Liliana D.

description:
Awesome taqueria 
Clean, fresh produce great service, everyone is super nice and hospitable, they really take the extra step to make sure your getting what you want.. 
Ceviche tostadas, grilled chicken, carnitas tacos are excellent! free chips and salsa as well 
Also the Micheladas are mental
author: Robin C.

description: Bayshore Taqueria is a great place!! I use to think the place was closed. Going with my fellow school bus drivers, I found out that it's not only open, the food is tasty and well prepared. Customer service was cool!  Yeaaaa...an affordable restaurant in the Bayview!
author: Lois C.

description: Seriously the highlight of my day! Love the food, service and environment.. That patio is perfect for me my dog and the sunshine
author: T. C.

description: I've never been offered samples while I decided what I wanted, but I was here! Super friendly service. Food is affordable and delicious. I'll be back!
author: Jesse S.

description: Got delivery, was pretty good. Fresh ingredients, not too greasy, authentic taste.
author: Salman A.

description: I am not sure the fuss here.  had the super veggie burrito which one review said was their favorite in the city - just beans and rice and lettuce- good crunchy lettuce but cheese was not melted into the burrito.  Chips at $1.25 extra which has to be the most I have ever paid for chips and one little cup of salsa and no salsa bar did not super impress me.  It was fine and there is nothing in that area so I don't say don't go there, but it didnt do it for me.
author: David G.

description: This place is spot on. I've been there often since I live down the street and every time I have something there, it's always fresh and delicious. Don't let the simplistic spartan sign put you off. This place is legit.
author: Arvey S.

description:
I've had breakfast and lunch here and can happily report that it doesn't get much better than this. For breakfast I had the eggs and chorizo. The chorizo and eggs were mixed together and accompanied by rice and beans, cream, and a  generous mound of tortillas. Everything was extremely fresh and delicious. Everything is a great value and each time I go I'm continually impressed with the freshness of their produce.

Since I wrote the above I've been back a handful of times. The burritos are always good. I've also chowed down on the enchiladas and chile rellenos. You really can't go wrong here and I'm so happy I can turn my otherwise crappy trips to Lowe's into satisfying outings!
author: Shaw V.

description: Omg this place was amazing. Literally walked in and was greeted nicely and it was sooo clean. Food was amazing! Also had good conversation with a worker there who use to play college baseball at same place I went to for basketball so felt like a welcoming environment. I will definitely come here more often
author: Major C.

description: If you close at 10 turn your dam open lights off. I hate wasting my time parking and walking across street and told by worker were closed. It's 10:20 pm and your dam open light is still on! Turn it off!
author: Keith A.

description: I went for lunch the other day ,in this takeria,the food sucks,carne asada had no flavor,the fried beens tasted like  4 days old beens and the rice same thing not a good taste,:( some people gives five stars because they don't know the real flavor for good Mexican food, and the sauce was not good.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Love this place! As a vegetarian, eating Mexican food can be a bit scary, as most use lard in their beans among other thing, Bayshore does not! (Even the refried beans are veggie friendly!) Their Super Veggie burrito is hands down my favorite burrito in SF and I love their chips (margaritas are great too)!

Staff is super friendly, attentive and FAST! Right off of the Cesar Chavez exit, great for a yummy quick burrito on your way home.  
I'll be back!
author: Sonya K.

description: Great spot! Best taqueria in SF. No complaints whatsoever...Tariq and the guys care about every customer. Great food...Great prices...Great service!
author: Trav G.

description: their food is good and very reasonable price. I went there twice and not only they are very humble but also gave me chips and salsa coz my order took more than expected time. i recommend them to anybody who wants good mexican food.
author: Anthony T.

description: Carne Asada Super Burrito was awesome. I have to try Carne Asada Super Tacos next time. The Aqua Fresca was refreshing.
author: Speed R.

description: My new favorite taqueria spot in the city ......After being a loyal El Farolito and Taqueria Cancun fan for many many years I think Iam going to have to throw in the towel  for them, the food is just not the same anymore. On the other hand Bayshore taqueria is an explosion in my mouth, the flavor is so good. So many different flavors the super burrito is big and has the best spices. Also try the super nachos, so good. I wish I had pictures but I demolished before I could take any pictures.
author: Tena A.

description:
Bayshore Taqueria is pretty damn good! My fiancé and I came here after work to use our Groupon and man.... I wish I woulda bought more. First off I must say its a little hidden & google map took us right past it but we found it pretty quick. We came in and the guy who took our order was super nice. We asked what were the most popular orders & he suggested the carnitas super burrito. He asked the guy in the back if there's was anymore cause they only make so much pork and it sells out. Luckily they had enough for about 2 burritos. We ended up getting 1 carnitas super burrito, 1 carne asada taco, chips & salsa & we got the free pineapple agua fresca for the yelp check in. All this for the $12 groupon I got for $5. SCORE!!! 
The burrito was one of the best burritos I've had in the city. The carnitas was juicy, tender and had crazy flavor! I'm glad we shared it cause it was huge. My fiancé loved the street taco with carne asada & the chips and salsa made every thing complete. 
I also liked how the worker came out and asked how our food was and even thanked as for coming in. We will most def will be coming back and also will check out their happy hour.
author: Rad V.

description: My favorite local taqueria...fresh great tasting food, friendly service and reasonable pricing! A bit of an industrial setting but who cares, makes my Lowes runs more enjoyable.
author: Saro N.

description: Tried this place as a result of buying a groupon.  Glad I did.  The food tasted great, the staff was very nice and kind, and got my food piping hot.  Would definitely recommend!
author: Alice C.

description: I wish I knew about this place sooner. I grabbed a Groupon deal with my boyfriend and boy were our bellies satisfied. He had the Wet 49er buritto and I had a carne asada quesadilla. We both loved our food and will definitely be coming back and try all the other items on their menu.
author: Annie V.

description: Good but nothing special. The poll asado is better than the shredded chicken-the shredded chicken was too wet for me.  The lettuce could have been fresher.
author: Thea S.

description: It's all its made out to be. Go for the tacos dorado style or super flour quesadilla.
author: Aaron L.

description: Best Taco's in the Bay! Great quality of food and preparation of ingredients you know it's fresh and organic! I come here 5 times a week and I am not sick of it!
author: adeeb r.

description: I would have never gone here in the past, but with the new ownership I have to say a found a new favorite spot. Everything was very tasty. The chips and salsa were bomb!
author: Pauline J.

description: Love this place, easily one of the oldest and most consistent customers, often eat here 2x a week. Usually a burrito, appreciate taco Tuesday. Seen the quality improve over time, tortas rock, taco salad, all good!!
author: R M.

description: I have always driven by this place but never got a chance to come by.  Today I stopped by for lunch.  The chips and salsa are fresh and delicious.  I also had the grilled chicken super burrito which was really good.  The employees here are superrr nice. Not something you normally experience at a taqueria.  I would definitely come back.
author: David S.

description: These guys are very kind. When I couldn't decide what meat to get, they gave me a sample of three of the meats. Who does that a Taqueria?!
author: C t.

description:
While waiting for my car, I ventured over to this spot today and was surprised by the affordable prices, super friendly staff, quality of their food and their honesty!

You could taste the quality and freshness by merely trying just a simple traditional taco.  And by the likes of other reviews regarding other dishes, it sounds like it's quality top down. They were even nice enough to ask how I enjoyed the food before I left. 

However what stood out the most was their honesty. We ran into a small change issue and without ANY hesitation, their staff was quick to resolve, replace and apologize (when it wasn't their fault).  

Their willingness to go above and beyond with being so polite, influenced me to leave half that balance as a tip for them.  

Thank you so much for a great first time experience!  I'll definitely be seeing you all again very soon!
author: Chad M.

description: I'll be back. Best mexican I've had for quite awhile. The combo plate with taco and enchiladas, both were tasty. Liked the mexican rice a lot. Liked the chips, liked black beans. Enjoyed their pineapple aqua fresca. Nice seating area too!
author: Kyle C.

description:
You don't have to go to the Mission for the best taqueria, it's on Bayshore! I have eaten at every taqueria in the Mission, and have enjoyed the all the highest rated spots, and thought I had found all my favorites after years of trying all the different taquerias. I absolutely love burritos and thought I wouldn't find anywhere that I enjoyed more than what I have already had. That's why I was extremely surprised when I tried Bayshore Taqueria and it blew me away, this place has the best nachos and burritos I've ever had, and the staff is soooo nice! Plus they've extended their hours to 8pm. Stop into Bayshore Taqueria and you won't be disappointed! 

P.S. I've never wanted to write a Yelp review before, but this place is such a hidden gem that I had to!
author: Blah B.

description: I had gotten tacos here before it changed hands, so I was interested to see how it was doing under new ownership. We needed some carnitas for our make-your-own tacos at home, so I dropped by to pick up a container to bring home. The owner chatted me up while I was waiting - very friendly and welcoming. He told me their hours, mentioned Taco Tuesdays, and told me that the outside seating is dog-friendly (how did he know?). He threw in complimentary chips and salsa. The half pound of carnitas ($8) was DELICIOUS. Can't wait to go back and try burritos, etc. Yum!!!
author: Esther L.

description:
I had eagerly been waiting for this place to open and I am so glad it is. Unlike other places (in Glen Park for example) which have started to charge more, give less beans and more rice in their diminishing burritos, Bayshore Taqueria's burritos are HUGE, full of beans and not hard on the pocketbook.

My only complaint is they sometime run out before I get my fix.

I stop there a couple times a month.
author: Laura M.

description: First time here and I had the dluxe quesadilla and first bite it was good. Gonna come back here and try everything else.
author: John A.

description: amazing! The guy at the counter was super nice and funny, like someone you already are friends with. Anything al pastor is my favorite, so I was not disappointed with my burrito bowl, at all! I would definitely suggest it, and I would go back there again, and again, and again and...you get it.
author: Andrea A.

description: New ownership, big improvement. Clean, fresh delicious food and friendly-excellent service. I highly recommend it.
author: Brendan H.

description:
WOW!

I really can't express how great the food is here. It's been under new ownership for one year, and it is fantastic now! I've been telling people how fantastic the food is here.

Since we "discovered" this place a month ago, we've been back three times. The food is FRESH! You can tell that they make their food batches on a daily basis. I'm getting hungry just by writing this review.

We've had the Huevos Rancheros, Enchiladas, Tacos and Tortas. All great. The guacamole and the pico de gallo are very fresh. Another thing I love about the food, is the fact that they serve lengua. I've had it in my tortas and tacos. 

Besides the food, I've got to mention how great the staff is. Always smiling, they greet you as soon as you walk in the door. They really appreciate your business, and it shows.
author: J M.

description: I got the super shrimp burrito and it was BOMB. The shrimp were very fresh tasting. They also offer different types of tortillas! Friendly service. It gets busy during lunchtime on weekdays but the service was still really quick!  Thy give samples of the chile verde and other items too if you want to try them
author: Jeni S.

description: Fresh food and great friendly service! Taco Tuesday is always a winner! I highly recommend this place, it's worth your time.
author: Nick A.

description: Running around getting errands done and needed a quick lunch. Fast friendly service. Favorites for us are the nachos and quesadillas. If you like lengua, they know how to make it tender and delicious here. Yum! Don't forget to check in to get your free horchata!
author: G C.

description:
OMG if I could give these assholes a -0 I would.
I ordered my food through Uber eats. The driver 
Delivered half of the food. I tried to get in touch with uber
With no luck as a matter of fact I think I'm still waiting to
hear back from them but anyway I called the restaurant
The owner initially seemed to be empathetic and
customer oriented he apologized and had uber Redeliver 
the other half of my order or so I thought. When the driver arrived 
the order was still missing some of the items I had initially
