ordered. I asked the Second uber driver to wait while I called 
the restaurant back thinking I would get the same understanding 
mgr. uuhhh no what I got was a stark raving lunatic that 
Preceded to yell and over talk me then he said and I
Quote"Your bitching about beans and rice Get over 
It we fucked up so just fuck it,I don't give a fuck don't ever 
order from us again." While he was yelling all of his
obscenities at me I kept trying to explain, it's the second 
time you've screwed the order up and that his customer 
Service skills or lack there of needed fine tuning.
needless to say I will never eat there again there are
A million good Mexican restaurants around so I won't 
be missing out on anything. Oh yeah he reminded me that 
he gave me a free beer for my troubles and that he took a 
loss. Here's the deal idiot I spent $40.00 bucks got half 
the order TWICE and gained a $3.00 beer so who really
took a loss.

Signed Pissed
author: Lisa W.

description: This place is fabulous we got two margaritas for free and the burritos were yummy! Nice outdoor patio as well.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Great Food, Great service!

Been coming to this place since it opened. The owner Tariq and his employees are very nice. Expect to get great food. I have been coming here pretty much every week since it has opened. I've tried a lot of different items on the menu and all of it is good. The meat is fresh and tasty. All the surrounding area taquerias are horrible and use cheap meat. Honestly it's been a long time since i've had good Mexican food in San Francisco. I thank Bayshore Taqueria for that.
author: Pat G.

description: Love this place. I have ordered food for my team at work a few times and I get more compliments about the food. Since I am the person who deals with the ordering it is awesome to know that they arrive on time and help with set up. Tarik has a great attention to details.
author: Ruth S.

description: This place rocks...talk about a Fiesta in your mouth. Awesome atmosphere and we'll worth the drive.
author: Jimmy S.

description:
Just finished the salad fajita bowl with carne asada and chile verde super burrito with red sauce on top.  Both were extremely delicious.  The fajita bowl was fried to order light and cirspy and was filled with a large portion of lettuce, beans, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, grilled peppers and onions and meat.  The burrito flavours were so savory and the rice cooked to a soft perfection.  This meal was shared by 3 of us and our bellies were happy and full.  We also tried their horchata which was very flavourful.

The man taking the order was very nice and helpful in making our selections and other two cooks also nice when I changed my order and added the meat to my fajita bowl.  Place was bright, food area was clean.  Service was prompt.

I parked up along side their wall which was easy enough but backing out you have to be careful to back up close to the sidewalk on the red light when the cars are waiting at the light on Bayshore then carefully watch the oncoming turning traffic directly across before merging.  I saw a sign for more parking down the block which was inside the restaurant but not really sure about where that was.  There needs to be more signage outside.  

I would come back for their food for takeout.
author: Hermann C.

description: Delicious and friendly taqueria. Not all great taquerias reside in the mission.  This place is worth the destination.  If your not sure what you want they will happily assist!!  My 7 year old wanted the name of the establishment as he was claiming it was his best taco ever.
author: Darren M.

description: I worked with Tariq to cater a birthday party at my home over the holidays and it was an A+ experience.  The food was fresh, delicious and not too greasy.  Our guests loved the cerviche and "build your own taco" experience.  Tariq was super responsive and arrived on time with all the trays in a heat preserving cart.  He also helped us set up the buffet line.  The pricing is very reasonable given the quality of the food and I would not hesitate to work with Tariq again.
author: C T.

description: Best taco salad I've had! Meat tender shell crisp and service was great! Thanks Tarik I'll be back. Oh and my man had a shrimp and chicken burrito that he hasn't stopped talking about , by far the best.
author: Sabrina W.

description: I wholeheartedly look forward to every time I'm in this city so I can come here! The food is authentic and mouth-watering. I also really appreciate a business where the owner actually interacts with his customers and that's exactly what I get every time I come here along with a whole bunch of happy smiling faces. I highly recommend!
author: Kayla W.

description: First time here and I fell in love with the food the burrito carnitas burrito was delicious! Hope you guys keep up the good work would recommend to any Mexican food lover to check this spot out!
author: Sam G.

description: Stopped by on my way to the airport and ordered my go to: 3 carne asada tacos. This place is spot on. The meat was tender and delicious with zero grizzle, and the produce was fresh and crispy. The staff was very pleasant and the owner was gracious when he served me. I will definitely go out of my way to eat here again. And next time, I'm going for the taco salad - looked delish!
author: Hayley F.

description: Excellent food and friendly service! We had the chile rellenos, enchiladas, fajitas, and veggie burritos and were NOT disappointed.   We consider ourselves Mexican food snobs :) If you are in the area, it is definitely a must-try.
author: Rana B.

description: The nachos in this place are incredible! LOTS of cheese and meat and beans. This is the way nachos should be made. Tarik, the owner is very friendly and will sit and chat with you a bit while your meal is being prepared. I agree with the others about how they prepare carne asada, it tastes perfect when they make it. And yes the service is FAST. It's always a joy to come in here.
author: Todd H.

description: i ordered the shrimp burrito. there are only three small shrimps inside. some beans and rice and almost nothing else. the taste is also very very average. this is probably the highest rating Mexican place i tried. but the food is probably 2 star at most. also, there is no salsa bar either. where are those 5 stars review come from???
author: Spirit L.

description: Rancid smelling oil, cold burritos full of unmelted cheese, dirty tables and floors.... Apparently they are also a daycare
author: joti l.

description: what a great new spot in the area! i am pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food and this place is better than many of the taco shops i have tried in the Mission. the folks here are clearly working hard to make it a success. ABSOLUTELY try it!
author: Sofia M.

description: Ok food, little confused about all the 5 stars. I had a super carne asada burrito, maybe they had an off day but something in the burrito tasted a little off, had a sour taste. Not planning to Come back. There tortilla chips were good though,
author: Tina A.

description: really flavorful food! love this place . i get a baby burrito with steak  on spinach tortilla, add guacamole and thank me later
author: Christina M.

description: The owner is super friendly and the food was really good. Looking forward to hanging out with my coworkers since we work so close to it.
author: Angie G.

description: Love this place! Fresh ingredients, great food and good prices. Love that dude Tarik too!
author: Ben W.

description: Hella good grub!! Fast service, great prices and excellent food and drink selection, some of the best tacos in SF!! Ask for "tatonka" he's the man that runs the show.
author: William H.

description: Couldn't wait to try this place. We really needed another good place to eat in our area and Bayshore Taqueria did not let us down!  Food was great- inexpensive and delicious.  I had a carne and shrimp quesadilla and my husband got the carnitas. They had a bunch of really good salsas that they make there and great fresh guacamole.
author: Amy M.

description: The best food I have had in a while. Great staff and excellent selection. Will definitely be eating here regularly!!!
author: Tim M.

description: Awesome, food is so good! Awesome happy happy hour! Large margaritas and amazing sangria!!! Tarack (sp?) gave great customer service. I will be back!
author: Chelsea W.

description: owner is chillll. love him. good food. will return.
author: Preet D.

description: This place is so good! Much better than the Taqs around mission and 24th. They gave me a dollar discount on top of the deal.
author: Zhe C.

description: Went in today for the first time, because our auto body guy across Bayshore Blvd. recommended we try it. I had the vegetarian burrito. One of the best I've ever eaten! Everything was super fresh. Service was very good, the owner was friendly, place was clean, prices are reasonable. This is my new favorite burrito palace.
author: Margo F.

description: Great food, great service, and best roasted salsa ever! Carnitas is tender and moist. Loved the Carne Asada on my tacos.
author: Crystal M.

description: Been here a couple of times and the food and service is beyond expectations.  Tarik is a great owner.  He gave me a discount because he knows I've been here before and a free large aqua fresca for checking in.  You can't beat that!!!  Hope they stay around for a long time.  Perfect place for fresh food and cheap prices.
author: Ed H.

description: This place is right around the corner from my work, but it had been empty for the last two years. Great location, right across Bayshore from The Old Clam House. I went by a couple of weeks ago when I saw there was a new restaurant in the space. Turns out this place is my new favorite taqueria, mainly because they are serving pozole and it's the most authentic version of my favorite Mexican stew. Loads of pork, some on the bone, perfectly seasoned red chile broth and loads of hominy - my biggest gripe about pozole is that most places are stingy with the hominy, but this pozole had just the right amount of hominy - a lot! I hope the new owners stick it out, if their food quality stays this high, they'll have a booming business.
author: Charles D.

description: Bayshore Taqueria is fairly new. It's up the street from our office so we decided to give it a try today. The place is simple but clean! The food is very fresh! I tasted lime/lemon juice in the fresh made chunky guacamole. My burrito was huge and stuffed with yummy goodness. The only thing that was a bit lacking to me was the al pastor, it was pretty flavorless but it won't stop me from trying something else next time.. maybe the nachos, they looked awesome!  Overall, I enjoyed the place!
author: V P.
